alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 12:18AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Choctaw, northwestern Washington, northwestern Clarke and northern Wayne Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1218 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dug Hill to 6 miles northwest of Lisman to 3 miles northwest of Crandall to near Stafford Springs. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Butler, Lisman, Silas, Coffeeville, Pennington, Gilbertown and Toxey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
